Document.Focus: How to stop smoking: Dealing with cravings

QAPair.Question: What is (are) How to stop smoking: Dealing with cravings ?
QAPair.Answer: A craving is a strong, distracting urge to smoke. Cravings are strongest when you first quit.

QAPair.Question: What causes How to stop smoking: Dealing with cravings ?
QAPair.Answer: When you first quit smoking , your body will go through nicotine withdrawal . You may feel tired, moody, and have headaches. In the past, you may have coped with these feelings by smoking a cigarette. Places and activities can trigger cravings. If you used to smoke after meals or when you talked on the phone, these things might make you crave a cigarette.
